result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  

Matter is dismissed and read into cases:  15CF665 & 15CF1496.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-11-2016 10:00 am
signed and filed.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.


Request for Judicial Transfer signed and filed.
Hearing at 01-22-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court addresses the new charge filed.  Attorney Smith advises the Court the Defendant is currently involved in treatment but is looking into additional treatment.  Attorney Smith requests a date after 1/20/16  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith advises the Court that the parties are still working on negotations and a global resolution with Branch 5 cases.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 11-16-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises his client has other charges and is looking at a global offer on all matters.  Defense advises these matters will consolidated and heard in Br. 5.  Court will adjourn the trial and give another date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 10-08-2015 10:30 am
Defendant Spencer C Grant in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
